meanings.definition: A colorless, pungent, crystalline compound found in chili peppers.
meanings.sent1: The chef added a pinch of capsaicin to the spicy curry.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the heat of capsaicin in the chili sauce.
meanings.sent3: The capsaicin in the peppers made my mouth feel like it was on fire!
meanings.sent4: Her passion for cooking was like capsaicin, adding intensity to every dish.
meanings.sent5: The capsaicin crystals sparkled like tiny diamonds in the pepper.

meanings.definition: A substance that produces a burning sensation on the skin and mucous membranes.
meanings.sent1: After cutting the chili peppers, I accidentally touched my eye and felt the burn of capsaicin.
meanings.sent2: The capsaicin in the muscle rub gave a warm sensation on my sore back.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the capsaicin in the lotion made her skin feel like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: The intensity of his words was like a touch of capsaicin on her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The capsaicin cream tingled on his skin, soothing the pain.
